verses.roman:
buddhyā brahmāpi hṛdayaṁ
nodatiṣṭhat tadā virāṭ
rudro 'bhimatyā hṛdayaṁ
nodatiṣṭhat tadā virāṭ

synonyms: buddhyā—with intelligence; brahmā—Lord Brahmā; api—also; hṛdayam—His heart; na—not; udatiṣṭhat—did arise; tadā—even then; virāṭ—the virāṭ-puruṣa; rudraḥ—Lord Śiva; abhimatyā—with the ego; hṛdayam—His heart; na—not; udatiṣṭhat—did arise; tadā—even then; virāṭ—the virāṭ-puruṣa.
translation: Brahmā also entered His heart with intelligence, but even then the Cosmic Being could not be prevailed upon to get up. Lord Rudra also entered His heart with the ego, but even then the Cosmic Being did not stir.
